message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: List<String> strings = Arrays.asList("s0", "s1", "s2", "s3", "s4");
Iterator<String> iterator = strings.stream().iterator();
String[] extracted = new String[2];
extracted[0] = iterator.next();
extracted[1] = iterator.next();
System.out.println(Arrays.toString(extracted));
<<<explanation>>>: You can convert the Stream to an Iterator using the iterator() method. Then, you can use the next() method of the Iterator to extract the desired elements from the Stream. In this example, we extract the first two elements from the Stream and store them in the "extracted" array. Finally, we print the contents of the "extracted" array.
